GameObjs

Class GameObj

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObjs.GameObj
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NullObj, Paper, Rock, Scissors

    public abstract class GameObj
extends java.lang.Object
    GameObj class is the parent class of any GameObj that is used within this game. Any Game Object created must inherit this class and its toString Method. Reflection used in cooperation of factory method to obtain GameObj specified via String Name.
    Author:
    mike

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int beats(GameObj obj)
      The leading GameObj calls this method and passes another GameObj.
      static GameObj newGameObj(java.lang.String gameObjName)
      Factory method using Reflection to obtain a new GameObj.
      abstract java.lang.String toString()
      The name given to this GameObj must match that of the GameObj placed within GameObjectChoice

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • beats

        public int beats(GameObj obj)
        The leading GameObj calls this method and passes another GameObj. This method will then compare the two objects and identify a winner/draw
        Parameters:
        GameObj -
        Returns:
        int - specifies to the calling class if the leading class.. won 1, lost -1, or drew 0

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        The name given to this GameObj must match that of the GameObj placed within GameObjectChoice
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • newGameObj

        public static GameObj newGameObj(java.lang.String gameObjName)
        Factory method using Reflection to obtain a new GameObj. Reflection was used so that any new GameObj in the future could be used. Due to the way Reflection is used GameObjs(package name) was added to each gameObject in order to correctly ascertain the right class
        Parameters:
        String - gameObjName (desired object to obtain)
        Returns:
        GameObj of type specified in parameter - Or Null Object - No Exceptions thrown
